intro: Streptolirion volubile, commonly known as the wandering jew, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a trailing or climbing plant with slender, wiry stems that can reach lengths of several meters. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, or white, which bloom in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It is often grown as a decorative plant in hanging baskets or as a ground cover due to its rapid growth and ornamental appeal.
